alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:51PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Volusia County through 115 PM EDT... At 1251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oak Hill. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oak Hill, Apollo Beach, Bethune Beach, Turtle Mound and Eldora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. On rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
